metadata.title: CVE-2015-5261 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in SPICE before 0.12.6 allows guest OS users toread and write to arbitrary memory locations on the host via guest QXLcommands related to surface creation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.5-1.1ubuntu2
spice-client - 0.12.5-1.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.5-1.1ubuntu2').
